intro: Jamesbrittenia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
